Articles.Content:
(i5-3230M, 6GB, GT740M 2GB)

I installed KSP today and it worked perfectly on highest settings (30-40 FPS), when I opened it few hours later it was slow (10 FPS). I didn't change anything in time between. What on Earth (irony ) is going on?!

(i5-3230M, 6GB, GT740M 2GB)

I installed KSP today and it worked perfectly on highest settings (30-40 FPS), when I opened it few hours later it was slow (10 FPS). I didn't change anything in time between. What on Earth (irony ) is going on?!

I would check the task manager if I were you. Maybe there is some process stealing cpu resources.
Whenever strange things happen like this, check the debug console(alt-f12) for clues. You can do this in game right when strange stuff is occurring.

Checked, still nothin'

[EDIT:]

[Log]: Skipped frame because GfxDevice is in invalid state (device lost)

It seems your running it on a laptop. Make sure you are either: A) Plugged in to a power source Running on High Performance battery mode. Laptops automatically decrease performance to save battery life when disconnected from power which I'm betting is the case here.

It seems your running it on a laptop. Make sure you are either: A) Plugged in to a power source Running on High Performance battery mode. Laptops automatically decrease performance to save battery life when disconnected from power which I'm betting is the case here.

That may very well answer a question I was asking myself the other day ('why?'). Makes sense to me now. Thanks.

Just tried with a fresh copy of KSP with no success. I previously even had Edge of Oblivion and it worked like charm...

Edited November 17, 2014 by viktor19
